config.question: Which of the following was an effect of the Navigation Act of 1660?

choices.content: It increased English control over trade with its colonies.
Restrictions were imposed on import of black labor from Africa.
The rights of colonists who traveled to the New World were clearly defined.
Duties and surcharges were imposed on goods imported to America.

answer_3.response: Parliament passed a Navigation Act in 1660. The act held that certain enumerated goods of great value that were not produced in England— tobacco, sugar, cotton, indigo, etc.—could be transported from the colonies only to an English or another colonial port.
